c74object.name: j.messageArray
c74object.digest: Handling array of messages in Jamoma model
c74object.description: j.messageArray creates an array of messages in a Jamoma model

inlet.digest: set the value of the selected instance(s)

objarg.name: OBJARG_NAME
objarg.digest: OSC name defining an array of messages in the namespace using a bracket-based syntaxe: my/message.[2]
objarg.description: OSC name defining an array of messages in the namespace using a bracket-based syntaxe: my/message.[2]

method.name: address
method.digest: The address message followed by an osc name containing a number of instances placed in bracket declares an array of messages in the namespace. Ex: 'address my/message.[5]'
method.description: The address message followed by an osc name containing a number of instances placed in bracket declares an array of messages in the namespace. Ex: 'address my/message.[5]'

method.name: array/select
method.digest: This message select which j.messageArray's instance to address
method.description: This message select which j.messageArray's instance to address

method.name: array/resize
method.digest: This message create a new array of j.messages
method.description: This message create a new array of j.messages

method.name: dec
method.digest: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the @value/stepsize attribute
method.description: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the @value/stepsize attribute

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump all attributes out the right-most outlet
method.description: Dump all attributes out the right-most outlet

method.name: inc
method.digest: Increment the value by the amount defined by the @value/stepsize attribute
method.description: Increment the value by the amount defined by the @value/stepsize attribute

method.name: reset
method.digest: Reset the selected j.message instance to its default state
method.description: Reset the selected j.message instance to its default state

attribute.name: active
attribute.digest: Set whether the array of j.message is enable or not
attribute.description: Set whether the array of j.message is enable or not

attribute.name: dataspace
attribute.digest: Set what dataspace used internally by the message for unit conversions
attribute.description: Set what dataspace used internally by the message for unit conversions

attribute.name: dataspace/unit
attribute.digest: The dataspace unit used for communication to the algorithm from the outside world
attribute.description: The dataspace unit used for communication to the algorithm from the outside world

attribute.name: description
attribute.digest: Short info about the message. Used for auto-documentation of the model
attribute.description: Short info about the message. Used for auto-documentation of the model

attribute.name: format
attribute.digest: Format of the values output: single or array
attribute.description: Format of the values output: single or array

enum.name: single
enum.digest: Values are output instance by instance
enum.description: Values are output instance by instance

attribute.name: ramp/drive
attribute.digest: Determines the mechanism used to drive ramping to new message values. Options are: none, Max
attribute.description: Determines the mechanism used to drive ramping to new message values. Options are: none, Max

attribute.name: ramp/function
attribute.digest: The mapping function determining the curve of the ramping to new message value
attribute.description: The mapping function determining the curve of the ramping to new message value

attribute.name: ramp/function/parameters
attribute.digest: Optional parameters for the chosen ramping function
attribute.description: Optional parameters for the chosen ramping function

attribute.name: range/bounds
attribute.digest: Lower and upper boundaries defining the range of possible message values
attribute.description: Lower and upper boundaries defining the range of possible message values

attribute.name: range/clipmode
attribute.digest: Define clipping behaviour at the boundaries of the message range. Options are: none, low, high, wrap, fold
attribute.description: Define clipping behaviour at the boundaries of the message range. Options are: none, low, high, wrap, fold

attribute.name: repetitions/allow
attribute.digest: Determines whether repeated message values will be filtered: when this attribute is disabled (default), repetitions are filtered out (like [change] object in Max)
attribute.description: Determines whether repeated message values will be filtered: when this attribute is disabled (default), repetitions are filtered out (like [change] object in Max)

attribute.name: type
attribute.digest: Datatype of the message. Options are: decimal, integer, boolean, string, array, generic
attribute.description: Datatype of the message. Options are: decimal, integer, boolean, string, array, generic

attribute.name: value/stepsize
attribute.digest: Step by which the current value is being increased/decreased when a /value/inc or /value/dec message is received
attribute.description: Step by which the current value is being increased/decreased when a /value/inc or /value/dec message is received
